intro: Onosma soltanabadensis, commonly known as the Soltanabad hedge mustard, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cold, arid environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and hairy, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. This species is of interest to botanists due to its unique ecological niche and limited distribution.
